meanings.sent1: The insurance company agreed to indemnify the homeowner for the damage caused by the storm.
meanings.sent2: The company promised to indemnify the customer for any financial losses due to their mistake.
meanings.sent3: To indemnify the clumsy waiter, the restaurant offered to cover the cost of the broken dishes.
meanings.sent4: The knight vowed to indemnify the villagers from the dragon's wrath by slaying the beast.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's main mission was to indemnify the city from evil villains and protect its citizens.

meanings.sent1: By signing the contract, the company sought to indemnify itself from any future lawsuits.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer advised his client to include a clause in the agreement to indemnify against legal claims.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to indemnify itself by blaming the missing cookies on the mischievous squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The magical amulet seemed to indemnify the wearer from all legal troubles, granting them immunity.
meanings.sent5: The shield was believed to indemnify the warrior from any curses or hexes cast by enemy sorcerers.

meanings.sent1: The company agreed to indemnify the employee for the travel expenses during the business trip.
meanings.sent2: The insurance policy would indemnify the policyholder for medical costs resulting from an accident.
meanings.sent3: To indemnify the student, the school refunded the money spent on the lost textbooks.
meanings.sent4: The generous donor decided to indemnify the charity for all the funds used to help the community.
meanings.sent5: The kind neighbor offered to indemnify the family for the repair costs of the damaged fence.
